results.title: The Cinematographer
results.brief_description: Directors of photography are members of the American Society of Cinematography. Produecrs and directors rely on them to integrate costumes, make-up, sets, and all production operations. Besides knowing how to operate cameras, lenses, dollies and lighting equipment, cinematographers must be artists in using light in ways most appropriate to the subject. The film includes several illustrative scenes, mostly concerned with lighting problems, from “Picture of Dorian Gray” and “Great Expectations”.

results.title: The Christmas visitor
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Presents an animated adaptation of Clement Moore’s poem entitled A visit from St. Nicholas. While Santa is resting, the toys from his bundle burst forth in a flurry of activity and the adventure of Christmas begins.

results.title: The Christmas burglars
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Christmas morning brings an unexpected pleasant surprise for a desperate mother and her young daughter. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Adele DeGarde, Charles Inslee, George Gebhardt, Mack Sennett, Harry Solter. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Children must learn
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Documentary Film Productions and Educational Film Institute of New York University
results.brief_description: Designed to illustrate the unsatisfactory relationship between education and the local necessities of life which characterises education in many parts of the USA. The film presents a study of farm families in the poorer mountain communities of the rural south, inadequately housed and clothed, ill-fed, living onland which yearly returns them less and less. One of the first tasks of education is to ensure that the children’s school curriculum meets the needs of their daily life.

results.title: The Children's physical education display on the Melbourne Cricket Ground
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Victoria. Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: The display of seven spectacular items, presented by 17,000 children aged 7 to 17, at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on March 4, 1954, in honour of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh, in front of a crowd of 92,000. Items arranged and directed by the Physical Education Branch. Music by RAAF Central Band.

results.title: The Children
results.creator_credit: Department of Public Information of the United Nations
results.brief_description: This film describes the work of the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund. It shows how the drive for increased food production, the health programs and the educational activities of UNICEF are being carried out in many areas to provide a more hopeful world for tomorrow’s citizens.

results.title: The Chaparral prince
results.creator_credit: Mark Cullingham, Elaine Sperber and Highgate Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a short story by O Henry, it tells the story of frail young Lena, who is hired out by her father to a wicked innkeeper. Lena finds escape in a book of fairy tales about handsome princes who save maidens in distress. When the innkeeper throws the book on the fire, a chain of events is started which proves to Lena that fairy tales can come true. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Challenge of water
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The challenge of Australia’s water resources - a problem, as good rainfall suited to agriculture occurs only in coastal regions. Describes government schemes for irrigation, hydro-electricity, reservoirs and other sources of water, including artesian bores. Indicates the widespread research which has made possible a better understanding of our climate today; includes work on evaporation control, artificial rain-making and sea-water utilisation.

results.title: The Challenge of change
results.brief_description: This video with accompanying trainer’s manual sets out to provide participants undertaking the training program with the knowledge and skills which will enable them to fully understand the impact, both positive and negative, of significant change in their work situation and how this impact may affect their interpersonal relationships both at work and in their family and social life.
